Description: Chicken Inasal is a famous barbecue dish from the Visayan islands, particularly the Negros and Iloilo areas. \n The meat is marinated in a mixture of calamansi, pepper, vinegar and annato, and then grilled over hot coals, while still being basted with the marinade.
Name of Restaurant: Eron\'s Cansi House
Location: Fr.M Ferrero St, Bacolod, Negros Occidental 6100 Philippines

Description: Cansi or kansi is a Filipino beef soup originating from Bacolod which is spread across the rest of the Western Visayas region. It is made with beef shank and bone marrow boiled until gelatinous. It is uniquely slightly soured with fruits like batuan. Cansi is usually cooked with unripe jackfruit, lemongrass, tomatoes, garlic, onions, fish sauce, and labuyo peppers.
Location: La Salle Ave 6100 Bacolod City Western Visayas

Description: A piaya is a muscovado-filled unleavened flatbread from the Philippines especially common in Negros Occidental where it is a popular delicacy. It is made by filling dough with a mixture of muscovado and water. The filled dough is then flattened with a rolling pin, sprinkled with sesame seeds and baked on a griddle.
